poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: He's at it. One big act. Muffled noises aft would be The future catching up on him. He asked for it. They axed him. Art is love and skill, it doesn't Look for applause - Though its vector might. There it's: arked and vaulted, The spectrum arched above it, Commodified, fat-arsed, Amped up, maybe Or wooden apsed and cloistered, Quiet, apt. Till ant and termite redeploy it Crumb by crumb And my old aunt gets morning mass In an empty church Auld kirk, an altar Native.
